title: China's resources, energy and sustainable development, 2020
subject: Energy policy -- China
Renewable energy sources -- Government policy -- China
Green technology -- China
Sustainable development -- China
Politique énergétique -- Chine
Énergies renouvelables -- Politique gouvernementale -- Chine

Sustainable development
China
description: This book explores sustainable development from the perspective of resources and energy, based on China's practical experience and cross-disciplinary research. It focuses on major challenges, key solutions and policy recommendations, and studies and explores seven important themes of resources, energy and sustainable development, including: 1) China's low-carbon energy transition, 2) China's urbanization and low-carbon development, 3) China's low-carbon action in cities, 4) China's low-carbon power transition, 5) China's water resources management, 6) electric vehicle development and key metal resources and 7) China's low-carbon development of the iron & steel industry. This book contributes to a more integrated understanding of many themes and their relationships in the area of resources, energy and sustainable development and guides the related policy and management.
contributor: Tsinghua-Rio Tinto Joint Research Centre for Resources, Energy and Sustainable Development, editor.$$QTsinghua-Rio Tinto Joint Research Centre for Resources, Energy and Sustainable Development
Institute of Climate Change and Sustainable Development (Qing hua da xue (Beijing, China)), editor.$$QInstitute of Climate Change and Sustainable Development (Qing hua da xue (Beijing, China))
contents: China's Energy Transition Strategy in the Context of Global Climate Change -- Research on Urbanization and Low-carbon Development in China -- Low-carbon Transition (peaking) of Chinese Cities: The Case of Beijing -- The Transition of China's Power System -- Reality and Challenges of China's Water Resources Management in the Context of Climate Change -- The Impacts of Electric Vehicles on Resources and Supply Chains Sustainability -- Development of Low Carbon Technology in China's Iron and Steel Industry.

abstract: This book explores sustainable development from the perspective of resources and energy, based on China's practical experience and cross-disciplinary research. It focuses on major challenges, key solutions and policy recommendations, and studies and explores seven important themes of resources, energy and sustainable development, including: 1) China's low-carbon energy transition, 2) China's urbanization and low-carbon development, 3) China's low-carbon action in cities, 4) China's low-carbon power transition, 5) China's water resources management, 6) electric vehicle development and key metal resources and 7) China's low-carbon development of the iron & steel industry. This book contributes to a more integrated understanding of many themes and their relationships in the area of resources, energy and sustainable development and guides the related policy and management.
